data.title: Classic tavern
data.text: Only had drinks, but the dinner menu looked great.  Wished we had more time. Enjoyed the bartender's information about the history of the tavern and some tips about Phoenix

data.title: Terrible Service
data.text:
Called into Toms Tavern for a beer and some food before attending a show.
Waited 10 mins and the water arrived.
Our drinks never arrived but the waiter came back and apologized claiming the barman was slammed. Re ordered the drinks. There were 30 people in the bar . NOT exactly Slammed.
Waited another 10 mins for our drinks then they arrived minus the lime my wife specifically asked for. No time to order food and make the show. Asked for the check and waited another 15 mins to pay.
This is the worst service I have experienced in Phoenix and the only place I have never left a tip .
I would hate to visit on a busy night.

data.title: Great special margarita & food!
data.text: I've been here several times now and it never disappoints. Their special (non-traditional) margarita is fabulous! I had a great pulled pork sandwich & I've been here a few times when they've had a nacho bar or other self serve food that has always been delicious!

data.title: History of This Place is Awesome
data.text: We went here as a stop on the Taste It Tours, glad we did. This place is packed with history. If you go, walk around the restaurant and look at all the fun photos and chat with the servers about the background stories. So much fun. We tried the pulled pork sandwich, which was good, and the margarita- amazing. Had a great time here.

data.title: Yes, cause I liked the whole vibe...
data.text:
Stopped here on a whim as I wondered looking for dinner
Almost seemed like executive chef was hosting as he smiled, greeted & seated several customers

Upscale-Sorta tavern menu balanced by 2 different types chili and bbq
Not sure what they it to be but my food was good.
Dark wood interior and plenty if outdoor seating
Good service.  

Cobb salad was really good
Yes, Above average just cause I liked the whole vibe

data.title: Not that good all round!
data.text: Defintely wouldn't go back there. Food was a combination of not cooked well, too raw, and missing elements.Service was very good - the food just didn't stand up well.

data.title: Margarita and Sliders = Great Yum factor
data.text: This was one of the stops on our Taste IT downtown Phoenix food tour.  We were served one of the best pulled pork sliders I've ever had along with one of the tastiest Margaritas we've ever had.   Next trip back to visit relatives, Tom's will be on our radar.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Stopped for a quick drink and thoroughly enjoyed the place. Nice atmosphere, great hot chocolate chip cookie and ice cream

data.title: Excellent Lunch at Tom's Tavern
data.text: Had lunch recently at Tom's Tavern. They consistently provide great service and their food has gotten much better since the reinvention of the restaurant a few years ago. This time we had the turkey burger and the cobb salad. On previous occasions we had the regular burger and the salmon caesar salad. The soup of the day was cellery. Our waitress offered to bring us a sample.  It brought back memories of Thanksgiving. Very delicious.

data.title: Can't  Handle Busy Nights
data.text:
I would have given Tom's  a 1 but because my whole tab was comped  I felt I owed  them at least a three.

Went there recently on a Friday night around 5:30 when there was a sold out show at the nearby arena and a ball game at the park. Every other restaurant  had long  Iines and waits. Tom's  had neither.

Took awhile for the waiter to stop by the table. We ordered very  basic bar food and 2 drinks. The food came before  the drinks. The manager helped to deliver the food and when I pointed out the delivery order he apologized and comped the drinks. Then it became obvious that there was 2 things  missing  off the order and the burger was severely undercooked.

Mistakes  were rectified and the whole meal was comped which was not necessary but very  much appreciated. 

If you want a basic bar with basic bar food and drink  choices  then yes go to Tom's. Just don't  do it on a night when there are multiple downtown events happening.

data.title: Excellent service and food
data.text:
April 30, 2015 three friends and I stopped in at Tom's Tavern for lunch. We were seated immediately and drinks came just as quick. The waitress was on top of her game and knew the menu and answered all questions easily.  The food arrived shortly after that and all was delicious. Even after we paid our check the waitress continued to check on us and refill our drinks.  I made a reservation for 10 to return on May 14th

May 14th instead of 10 there were 24 of us. We went early expecting the meal to take longer due to the large group and Tom's was ready for us. They were so efficient that we were all served as if we were a smaller table of guest and the food was excellent. All 24 of us were pleased with our meal, not one complaint.

Since our meal came so quickly we had an hour to wait until our tour of the Orpheum theater and Tom's did not pressure us to leave but continued to refill our drinks. The Assistant Manager was so gracious to stop by and tell us the history behind the Tavern.

Tom's Tavern is beautiful inside and is quiet enough to hold a conversation with your companion across the table. That alone is reason enough to chose Tom's.

data.title: Basic fare - good service
data.text: We arrived c7.15 and didn't know it closed at 8 pm. This wasn't mentioned by the staff which was good although it meant we felt a bit pressured to finish up quickly (we are generally fast eaters anyway). The menu is pretty basic and not overly exciting and the food was ok - I would call it functional eating rather than dining. The service was good.

data.title: Spicy and Pricey
data.text: The chili was so good, my colleague got another bowl after dinner. My BBQ pork was tasty but a bit dry; should have asked for BBQ dipping sauce. His Southwest Chopp salad was good. Closes relatively early (10PM) on weekdays, which was especially odd, since there was a baseball game going on, about five blocks away. They are intentionally?) missing the After Game imbibers?  This is more of a trendy American restaurant than it is a

data.title: same good quality
data.text: I expected restaurants to have the same quality each time I eat there and Tom's does not disappoint.  I had my standard Cuban sandwich and my guest had a burger.

data.title: Service was A Little Slow
data.text: Stopping by to grab a quick bite to eat at lunch before our afternoon meeting, three of us sat on the outside patio and enjoyed the view.  Unfortunately, service was slow and we had to hunt down our waiter.  The chicken quesadillas and crab/shrimp Louie were delicious as were the beers.  Good points and bad points.  Maybe we just hit the place at the wrong time.

data.title: Good drinks and food.
data.text: They were tired from the Super Bowl. But still had good pulled pork sandwich and bloody ceaser.  Reasonably priced and in downtown pheonix.

user_location.name: A small town in Northwest Washington

data.title: Poorly Run Place...get help
data.text: So...while I get that it's Super Bowl weekend, and the city is insane...I would give 0 stars to this place if I could.  4 of us walked in during prime time Super Bowl weekend.  As we ask for a table, we are told they are no longer seating anyone, and we had to wait 25 minutes before it would start up again.  After waiting 45 minutes, I walked through the dining room to find 5 completely empty tables.  When discussing the seating situation with the hostess, I am told "there are plenty of other places you can go to on Washington St."  Who tells a customer this?  Others complained and asked for the manager, but they were told "he's too busy to come out and talk to you".  Horrible way of handling the crowds.  We ended up leaving after around an hour of waiting, and ate somewhere else.  I would never go back.

data.title: No thanks...
data.text:
The reason my wife and I came to Tom's Tavern was to celebrate her retirement after twenty years of working in the Maricopa court system. I was hoping this would be something we would remember with fond memories, but what we experienced was not that.
We arrived shortly after opening on January 6, 2015. I ordered a brisket sandwich and my wife pulled pork sandwich. We received our food in about twenty five minutes. After taking the first bite of my brisket sandwich I realized it was extremely tough. Ugh! I took a closer look and noticed that the meat was DRY and did not look good. I then cut the meat with a knife (hard to do) and tried just the meat. It was tough and had little taste. Certainly not what brisket should taste like and definitely the worst I had ever had... period. I thought okay this could just be a bad menu choice, but then I looked at my wife and after a bite of her pulled pork sandwich she removed the bun and started "picking" around with a fork. I asked her what was going on and she said no worries, it's okay. She is a very kind lady and would never complain, so I inquired further and she said the sandwich was almost all fat and quietly said nothing else. My wife is NOT a picky eater so this was to take note of. After some time I realized she just pushed the plate to the edge of the table and a server picked it up. What are the chances both our lunches were a fluke. Hence my review and know that I do this just to forewarn others and to say shame on you (management) for allowing "food" like this to be served. Not the memorable experience we were hoping for.

data.title: Great Service!
data.text: I sat at the bar and watched an amazing bartender juggle multiple patrons and provide excellent service.  The beer was very cold, pleasant atmosphere.  I ate a chicken quesadilla that was average but I will return when visiting downtown Phoenix in the future.

owner_response.author: jfpphoenix, Public Relations Manager at Tom's Tavern & 1929 Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the kind words about our bartenders! they're terrific and we love when our customers recognize it too!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Just what we needed
data.text:
Arriving in Phoenix after a 14 hour flight from Sydney to LA then transfer to the local domestic terminal, two hours down time & an hour to Phoenix we were ready for a meal.

Downtown Phoenix is a bit dead even for a Friday evening -in fact it looked like a ghost town. (Apparently Scottsdale is the "place") We found Tom's Tavern - a nice meal, cold beers, cocktails, good service.  Loved it.

owner_response.author: jfpphoenix, Public Relations Manager at Tom's Tavern & 1929 Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Sounds like quite a trip you had. We're glad that you found us and enjoyed you evening at Tom's. 

Hope you enjoyed Arizona and had a safe trip back home!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
